alert.note: Alert for Blaine (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 8:40PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Blaine County through 915 PM MDT... At 839 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles southwest of Fort Belknap, or 22 miles southeast of Chinook, moving north at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, nickel size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Ponding of water on roadways will cause difficult driving on rural roads. Locations impacted include... Zurich. This includes Highway 2 between mile markers 405 and 422. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
